result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Garza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Garza was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Robert Garza was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fines, costs, DNA & Domestic Surcharges within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week. (bond applied--balance due.)

9.05 a.m.   Defendant Robert  Garza in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. ($200 + costs both counts 2 & 3)
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: No Contest 
Count 3: No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 1 is dismissed outright.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield concurs with joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:***
Count 2: $200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic  = $805.00
Count 3: $$200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic = $805.00
3 day credit noted on the record.
  Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

BTC: Defendant to be released from jail.

 Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.

Bond Continued  Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
